alert.note: Alert for Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet; Logan County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 31 at 11:57PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Northern Front Range Foothills, I-25 Corridor, Palmer Divide, and northeast plains of Colorado. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Another round of heavy rain producing thunderstorms is expected again Tuesday afternoon and evening. Stronger storms will be capable of producing 1 to 2 inches of rain in 45 minutes or less.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
